bitfield.description: HW Reserved regiser
HW Reserved regiser
HW Reserved regiser
HW Reserved regiser
Write 0x1 to generate a marker on Flush trigger
Enable the corresponding range for data capture. Bit 0 : 0: Range 0 is disabled 1 : Range 0 is enableld
Write 0x1 to enable HW Marker trigger to generate a Flush
Write 0x1 to enable HW Marker trigger to generate a Marker
Chop of the sign extension bits [15:12] for every 16 bits of data. 0 : Send all 16 bits 1 : Send lower 12 of 16 bits
Select which bus to capture. 0 : Read Bus 1 : Write Bus
Indicates is the sniffer block is active or inactive. 0 : Captuere is Disabled 1 : Sniffer Enabled
Range 0 Start address OR Start param number for HWA , which needs to be captured
Range 0 End address OR End param number for HWA , which needs to be captured
Range 1 Start address OR Start param number for HWA , which needs to be captured
Range 1 End address OR End param number for HWA , which needs to be captured
Range 2 Start address OR Start param number for HWA , which needs to be captured
Range 2 End address OR End param number for HWA , which needs to be captured
Range 3 Start address OR Start param number for HWA , which needs to be captured
Range 3 End address OR End param number for HWA , which needs to be captured
Write 0x1 to trigger a Flush. A marker packet will also be inserted
Write 0x1 to insert a Marker
The FIFO threshold to trigger writes from the Source FIFO. This value is in multiples of 32 bytes. If SRCx_BW_CTRL_WRITE_MODE is 0x0, then the bits [9:5] of this field need to be programmed to 0x0
0 : Highest Dynamic Priority 7 : Lowest Dynamic Priority
The burst_size is the minimum size for which the SRC will keep arbitration once it wins . The value in multiples of 32 bytes
The FIFO threshold to trigger writes from the Source FIFO. Value to be aligned to 32 bytes [4:0] should be 0x0
0 : Send data equivalent to burst_count * burst_size 1 : Send data equivalent to threshold size. This can be set only if threshold is less than 1024 bytes
Configure the STM Channel Number
Selects whether the Non Data access for the Source is timestamped 0 : No Timestamp 1 : Timestamped
Selects whether the Non Data access for the Source is Guaranteed or Invariant Timing 0 : Time Invariant 1 : Guaranteed
Selects whether the Data access for the Source is timestamped 0 : No Timestamp 1 : Timestamped
Selects whether the Data access for the Source is marked 0 : Un-Marked 1 : Marked
Selects whether the Data access for the Source is Guaranteed or Invariant Timing 0 : Time Invariant 1 : Guaranteed

Status of the Sniffer for Source 0
Source Overflow Error is generated with the Source FIFO is full and there is no space to write the sniffed data
Flush Err is generated on Multiple Flush requests
Data Miss Erro is generated when a Flush or Marker Requested causes Miss in the Sniffer data
Flush Done is generated on completion of a flush request
Status of the Sniffer for Source 1
Source Overflow Error is generated with the Source FIFO is full and there is no space to write the sniffed data
Flush Err is generated on Multiple Flush requests

Flush Done is generated on completion of a flush request

- KICK0 component

Proxy0 access violation error. Raw status is read. Write a 1 to set the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Kick access violation error. Raw status is read. Write a 1 to set the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Addressing violation error. Raw status is read. Write a 1 to set the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Protection violation error. Raw status is read. Write a 1 to set the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Proxy0 access violation error. Enabled status is read. Write a 1 to clear the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Kick access violation error. Enabled status is read. Write a 1 to clear the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Addressing violation error. Enabled status is read. Write a 1 to clear the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Protection violation error. Enabled status is read. Write a 1 to clear the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Proxy0 access violation error enable. Write a 1 to set the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Kick access violation error enable. Write a 1 to set the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Addressing violation error enable. Write a 1 to set the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Protection violation error enable. Write a 1 to set the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Proxy0 access violation error enable clear. Write a 1 to clear the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Kick access violation error enable clear. Write a 1 to clear the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Addressing violation error enable clear. Write a 1 to clear the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Protection violation error enable clear. Write a 1 to clear the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
EOI vector value. Write this with interrupt distribution value in the chip.
Fault Address.
Non-secure access.

Fault Type 10_0000 = Supervisor read fault - priv = 1 dir = 1 dtype != 1 01_0000 = Supervisor write fault - priv = 1 dir = 0 00_1000 = Supervisor execute fault - priv = 1 dir = 1 dtype = 1 00_0100 = User read fault - priv = 0 dir = 1 dtype = 1 00_0010 = User write fault - priv = 0 dir = 0 00_0001 = User execute fault - priv = 0 dir = 1 dtype = 1 00_0000 = No fault
Route ID.
Privilege ID.
Fault clear. Writing a 1 clears the current fault. Writing a 0 has no effect.
